title: This Isn't GOODBYE .. It's SEE YOU LATER
body_text:
It was promised that at 2009's kick-off event, DODGEBALL 171, a certain announcement would send shockwaves across the
EastCoastDodgeball
community.
"The Writer's" right-hand man John Tronolone laid the rumors to rest, publicly announcing his retirement from both active competition and behind-the-scenes collaboration. Those who heard the news stood in awe, perhaps questioning the possible reasons for such an action. According to Tronolone, it was a "long, long time coming" and a decision he had been battling for the last several months.
The length of Tronolone's - and "The Writer's" - hiatus is currently unknown, although both have vowed that it is only "temporary".
________________________________________
________________________
ECD's
elitest couldn't have been more rarin' to go for this year-end spectacle. What a way to go out then with this ...
"Eamon"
for your mortal sworn enemies was the absolute key to oppositional extermination. And the Fitzpatricks' youngest comodity tore through veterans
Kevin Adams
and
John Tronolone
without much difficulty.
Season 17
The initial tennis light troubles, WALL-ALL battles NINE and TEN, Thanksgiving's massive
Megill v. C. Adams II
, and Tronolone retaining his captaincy against a
CREAMated
Letsche were some key highlights over this ten week program.
Average attendance was 19.6 with 40% of the events reaching exactly 18. Throughout the ten weeks,
ECD
welcomed 5 new stars.
Justin Wolf, Jon Yochum, Michael "Sputz" Krott, John Tronolone, and Kevin Fitzpatrick participated in every Season 17 event spanning from DODGEBALL 161 on October 25 to the December 27 Finale, DODGEBALL C70.
DODGEBALL C70
Purple and white table clothes were draped along in the inside fence while white streamers were carefully rolled around each of the four tennis poles.
The music playlist was created by the first lady of dodgeball Diana DiBuccio. "Superstar" by Lupe Fiasco kicked off the multi-hour compilation with hits particularly from HipHop/R&B genre.
First pick for "David" Mullins:
John Tronolone
First pick for "Goliath" Krott:
Kevin Fitzpatrick
Online Exclusive!
The special
GodMode Rules
stipulation was agreed upon and then added less than a week before C70 itself.
DODGEBALL C70 was featured
26 total participants
, which is the highest attendance since the Season 16 Finale in mid-October.
The official theme song was "Superstar" by Lupe Fiasco feat. Matthew Santos.
DODGEBALL C70 was the fourth consecutive ten event held on the back courts of Wall High School, and the tenth overall. It was also the third finale to take place in the month of December following an unforgettable
DODGEBALL 20:
The ClimaXX
in 2005 and the revolutionary Chris Adams-Kevin Fitzpatrick clash at
DODGEBALL 70
in 2006.
The "Biblical Battle" between Michelle Mullins and Michael "Sputz" Krott was not only the first intergender singles match-up in season finale history, but also the first to include a match stipulation. Every preceeding ten event was contested under classic two-team rules.
Michelle Mullins
headlined her first season finale. Her record is 0-2-1.
Michael Krott
headlined his second season finale, the first DODGEBALL CX. This was his second
GodMode Rules
contest and shockingly, his very first singles conest. His record is 1-1-0.</center>
body_html:
It was promised that at 2009's kick-off event, DODGEBALL 171, a certain announcement would send shockwaves across the EastCoastDodgeball community.

"The Writer's" right-hand man John Tronolone laid the rumors to rest, publicly announcing his retirement from both active competition and behind-the-scenes collaboration. Those who heard the news stood in awe, perhaps questioning the possible reasons for such an action. According to Tronolone, it was a "long, long time coming" and a decision he had been battling for the last several months.

The length of Tronolone's - and "The Writer's" - hiatus is currently unknown, although both have vowed that it is only "temporary".

________________________________________________________________

ECD's elitest couldn't have been more rarin' to go for this year-end spectacle. What a way to go out then with this ...

"Eamon" for your mortal sworn enemies was the absolute key to oppositional extermination. And the Fitzpatricks' youngest comodity tore through veterans Kevin Adams and John Tronolone without much difficulty.

Season 17
  • The initial tennis light troubles, WALL-ALL battles NINE and TEN, Thanksgiving's massive Megill v. C. Adams II, and Tronolone retaining his captaincy against a CREAMated Letsche were some key highlights over this ten week program.
  • Average attendance was 19.6 with 40% of the events reaching exactly 18. Throughout the ten weeks, ECD welcomed 5 new stars.
  • Justin Wolf, Jon Yochum, Michael "Sputz" Krott, John Tronolone, and Kevin Fitzpatrick participated in every Season 17 event spanning from DODGEBALL 161 on October 25 to the December 27 Finale, DODGEBALL C70.

    DODGEBALL C70
  • Purple and white table clothes were draped along in the inside fence while white streamers were carefully rolled around each of the four tennis poles.
  • The music playlist was created by the first lady of dodgeball Diana DiBuccio. "Superstar" by Lupe Fiasco kicked off the multi-hour compilation with hits particularly from HipHop/R&B genre.
  • First pick for "David" Mullins: John Tronolone
  • First pick for "Goliath" Krott: Kevin Fitzpatrick

    Online Exclusive!
    The special GodMode Rules stipulation was agreed upon and then added less than a week before C70 itself.


    DODGEBALL C70 was featured 26 total participants, which is the highest attendance since the Season 16 Finale in mid-October.

    The official theme song was "Superstar" by Lupe Fiasco feat. Matthew Santos.

    DODGEBALL C70 was the fourth consecutive ten event held on the back courts of Wall High School, and the tenth overall. It was also the third finale to take place in the month of December following an unforgettable DODGEBALL 20: The ClimaXX in 2005 and the revolutionary Chris Adams-Kevin Fitzpatrick clash at DODGEBALL 70 in 2006.

    The "Biblical Battle" between Michelle Mullins and Michael "Sputz" Krott was not only the first intergender singles match-up in season finale history, but also the first to include a match stipulation. Every preceeding ten event was contested under classic two-team rules.
  • Michelle Mullins headlined her first season finale. Her record is 0-2-1.
  • Michael Krott headlined his second season finale, the first DODGEBALL CX. This was his second GodMode Rules contest and shockingly, his very first singles conest. His record is 1-1-0.</center>
